title_full: IOTREL01-BP01 Use NTP to maintain time synchronization on devices
title: Use NTP to maintain time synchronization on devices
description: Ensure your device consistently keeps its internal clock accurate by using NTP (Network Time Protocol) to maintain time synchronization. Accurate time is essential for security certificate validation, log correlation, and time-based operations.

title_full: IOTREL01-BP02 Provide devices access to NTP servers
title: Provide devices access to NTP servers
description: Configure network access for IoT devices to reach NTP servers for time synchronization. Consider using Amazon Time Sync Service or deploying local NTP servers for devices with restricted internet access.

title_full: IOTREL02-BP01 Manage service quotas and constraints
title: Manage service quotas and constraints
description: Manage service quotas and limits for peaks in your IoT workload by monitoring usage, requesting quota increases proactively, and designing applications to handle throttling gracefully. Use AWS Service Quotas to track and manage limits.

title_full: IOTREL03-BP01 Down sample data to reduce storage requirements and network utilization
title: Down sample data to reduce storage requirements and network utilization
description: Design workloads to operate efficiently within network bandwidth and storage constraints by down sampling data. Aggregate and compress data at the edge to reduce storage requirements and network utilization while preserving essential information.

title_full: IOTREL04-BP01 Target messages to relevant devices
title: Target messages to relevant devices
description: Optimize and control message delivery frequency to IoT devices by targeting messages only to relevant devices. Use device groups, thing attributes, and topic filtering to ensure messages reach only the intended recipients.

title_full: IOTREL04-BP02 Implement retry and back off logic to support throttling by device type
title: Implement retry and back off logic to support throttling by device type
description: Implement retry logic with exponential backoff to handle throttling conditions gracefully. Design device firmware to manage connection retries intelligently based on device type and network conditions.

title_full: IOTREL05-BP01 Decouple IoT applications from the Connectivity Layer through an Ingestion Layer
title: Decouple IoT applications from the Connectivity Layer through an Ingestion Layer
description: Manage data ingestion and processing throughput for IoT workloads by decoupling applications from the connectivity layer through an ingestion layer. Use message queues and streaming services to buffer and process data independently.

title_full: IOTREL06-BP01 Dynamically scale cloud resources based on the utilization
title: Dynamically scale cloud resources based on the utilization
description: Facilitate reliable processing and delivery of IoT messages by dynamically scaling cloud resources based on utilization. Configure auto-scaling for processing components to handle variable IoT workloads.

title_full: IOTREL07-BP01 Store data before processing
title: Store data before processing
description: Provision storage strategies for IoT data by storing data before processing. This ensures data durability and enables replay capabilities for failed processing attempts or downstream application failures.

title_full: IOTREL07-BP02 Implement storage redundancy and failover mechanisms for IoT data persistence
title: Implement storage redundancy and failover mechanisms for IoT data persistence
description: Implement storage redundancy and failover mechanisms to ensure IoT data persistence. Use multi-AZ deployments and cross-region replication for critical IoT data to protect against data loss.

title_full: IOTREL08-BP01 Use a mechanism to deploy and monitor firmware updates
title: Use a mechanism to deploy and monitor firmware updates
description: Update device firmware on IoT devices using a mechanism to deploy and monitor firmware updates. Use AWS IoT Jobs or similar services to orchestrate, track, and verify firmware updates across your device fleet.

title_full: IOTREL08-BP02 Configure firmware rollback capabilities in devices
title: Configure firmware rollback capabilities in devices
description: Configure firmware rollback capabilities in devices to recover from failed or problematic firmware updates. Design devices with multiple firmware partitions to enable safe rollback to previous working versions.

title_full: IOTREL08-BP03 Implement support for incremental updates to target device groups
title: Implement support for incremental updates to target device groups
description: Implement support for incremental or staged firmware updates to target specific device groups. Use canary deployments and gradual rollouts to minimize the impact of potentially problematic updates.

title_full: IOTREL08-BP04 Implement dynamic configuration management for devices
title: Implement dynamic configuration management for devices
description: Implement dynamic configuration management for devices to enable remote configuration changes without firmware updates. Use device shadows or configuration services to manage device settings dynamically.

title_full: IOTREL09-BP01 Implement device simulation to synthesize the entire flow of IoT data
title: Implement device simulation to synthesize the entire flow of IoT data
description: Perform functional testing for your IoT solution by implementing device simulation to synthesize the entire flow of IoT data. Use device simulators to test edge cases, scale testing, and failure scenarios.

title_full: IOTREL10-BP01 Use cloud service capabilities to handle component failures
title: Use cloud service capabilities to handle component failures
description: Implement your IoT workload to withstand component and system faults by using cloud service capabilities to handle failures. Leverage managed services with built-in high availability and design for graceful degradation.

title_full: IOTREL11-BP01 Implement device logic to automatically reconnect to the cloud
title: Implement device logic to automatically reconnect to the cloud
description: Verify that your IoT device operates with intermittent connectivity by implementing device logic to automatically reconnect to the cloud. Design robust reconnection logic with exponential backoff and jitter.

title_full: IOTREL11-BP02 Design devices to use multiple methods of communication
title: Design devices to use multiple methods of communication
description: Design devices with multiple communication methods to handle connectivity failures. Implement fallback communication channels such as cellular backup for WiFi-primary devices.

title_full: IOTREL11-BP03 Automate alerting for devices that are unable to reconnect
title: Automate alerting for devices that are unable to reconnect
description: Automate alerting for devices that are unable to reconnect to identify connectivity issues quickly. Monitor device connectivity status and configure alerts for extended disconnection periods.

title_full: IOTREL12-BP01 Provide adequate device storage for offline operations
title: Provide adequate device storage for offline operations
description: Verify that required data is transmitted to the cloud after disconnection by providing adequate device storage for offline operations. Size local storage to accommodate expected disconnection durations and data generation rates.

title_full: IOTREL12-BP02 Synchronize device states upon connection to the cloud
title: Synchronize device states upon connection to the cloud
description: Synchronize device states upon reconnection to the cloud to ensure consistency between device and cloud-side state. Use device shadows for bidirectional state synchronization after connectivity is restored.

title_full: IOTREL13-BP01 Configure cloud services to reliably handle message processing
title: Configure cloud services to reliably handle message processing
description: Remotely adjust message frequency to IoT devices by configuring cloud services to reliably handle message processing. Use message queues and dead letter queues to handle processing failures.

title_full: IOTREL13-BP02 Send logs directly to the cloud
title: Send logs directly to the cloud
description: Send device logs directly to the cloud for centralized analysis and troubleshooting. Use structured logging formats and configure log retention policies appropriate for your operational needs.

title_full: IOTREL13-BP03 Design devices to allow for remote configuration of message publication frequency
title: Design devices to allow for remote configuration of message publication frequency
description: Design devices to allow remote configuration of message publication frequency. Enable dynamic adjustment of telemetry rates based on operational requirements and network conditions.

title_full: IOTREL14-BP01 Design server software to initiate communication only with devices that are online
title: Design server software to initiate communication only with devices that are online
description: Plan for disaster recovery in IoT workloads by designing server software to initiate communication only with devices that are online. Track device connectivity status and queue messages for offline devices.

title_full: IOTREL14-BP02 Implement multi-Region support for IoT applications and devices
title: Implement multi-Region support for IoT applications and devices
description: Implement multi-Region support for IoT applications and devices to ensure business continuity during regional outages. Design device firmware to connect to backup regions when primary regions are unavailable.

title_full: IOTREL14-BP03 Use edge devices to store and analyze data
title: Use edge devices to store and analyze data
description: Use edge devices to store and analyze data locally for disaster recovery and reduced latency. Deploy AWS IoT Greengrass to enable local processing and storage when cloud connectivity is unavailable.
